Some people who received this message don't often get email from redfox802@btinternet.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
﻿
﻿ District Attorney Ozanne

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms a Corporation , not animal rescue living Men & woman

Respectfully,

r fox
Sent from my iPhone

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Animals should not be experimented on. Period. They are not ours to use, abuse, or exploit. This is highly unethical and cruel.

Respectfully,

Hetvi Shah

District Attorney Ozanne,

I have recently been made aware that criminal animal abuse is taking place under your county. Why is the prosecution being directed to those who intend to rescue the disrespected life and not to those committing violent acts against our fellow inhabitants? Ridglan Farms in Dane county has been operating under the constant violations against state animal cruelty laws such as non-anesthetized surgical mutilations, psychologically traumatic solitary confinement, and over all mistreatment, all under your watch. Am I supposed to sit here in silence while you have thousands of lives hanging off the palm of your hands or are you going to do something about it?

Respectfully,
Kelsey Señeres

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

Ridglan Farms is breaking the laws that you are bound to uphold. I am asking you to do your job.


Whatever Ridglan is attempting to hide behind locked doors needs to be exposed to the public, and to your self. Please hold them accountable for the harm they are committing.


And please back-off of the people who fight for what is morally right. Please stand on the RIGHT side of the law!



Respectfully,

Terri Pecora



[Some people who received this message don't often get email from hermetic1@earthlink.net. Learn why this is important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ]

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I am appalled by your lack of interest in stopping the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. As you know, over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, including

* Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
* Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
* Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you attempted to prosecute the rescuers of these dogs. Indeed, you would have, if Ridglan themselves had not requested the case be dropped, because they did not want the full scale of their crimes revealed during the course of the trial.

Mr. Ozanne, it is time for your to do your job. Thousands of dogs in Dane County are enduring criminal abuse, right now. Your are morally and ethically obligated to prosecute Ridglan Farms for their decades-long crime spree.

Respectfully,

Edward Macan
Eureka, California

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Dogs give so much to people; they are man (and woman’s) best friend. They offer us solace and friendship and deserve to be treated with kindness and not cruelty.

Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *
Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *
Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *
Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. I ask that you prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Dane County District Attorney's Office,

As a child, I grew up with a beagle we had at home. Our dog was a wonderful being who taught me about love and affection. With that in mind, I am deeply saddened to learn of the animal abuse occurring at Ridglan Farms. This abuse includes surgery without anesthesia and housing these highly social creatures in solitary wire cages. This must stop. Please use the power of your office to prosecute those abusing animals rather than those rescuing animals.

With respect,
Nakul Vyas

[You don't often get email from shearessencealpacas@me.com. Learn why this is important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ]

Hello,

I am writing because of the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County.  This can no longer be shoved under the rug.   Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

• Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
• Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
• Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Thousands of these animals in breeding facilities in our state live a miserable caged existence, bred for unnecessary experiments that do not transfer to human use.   Wisconsin is one of the epicenters of animal research in the United States and has the dubious distinction of being #1 in the United States for research on both dogs and cats; #2 for rabbits.

Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Melanie Weberg
Director, League of Humane Voters - Wisconsin
www.lohvwi.com

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Some people who received this message don't often get email from danielle.hartteo@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I am horrified at the horrific animal abuse that had transpired at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. That must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. These are sentient beings who feel pain and terror just as much as you and I. The tide is turning and soon we will look back on such practices as totally barbarian and unnecessary. Please be at the forefront of this movement. Show compassion. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Danielle Hart

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

Martha Readyoff

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I believe that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be stopped. Over decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Each moment you allow this abuse to continue unchecked, you allow these dogs to suffer unimaginable cruelty.


I believe it is your job to do everything in your power to defend those who can’t defend themselves—including the animals in your district who need someone in your position to fight for them. I hope you will stand with the animal rescuers who have put their own safety and futures on the line to save lives. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Casey Mysliwy

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

They inject puppies with rabies to test new vaccines and forcefeed them laundry detergent until they die from vomiting blood. This is absolutely deplorable and sickening.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Patrick

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing to you with great concern over the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County which must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present.
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs.
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.

These abuses have taken place over a multi-year timespan with no indication that the problems have been addressed (including as recently as December 2023)

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Michael Davanzo

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

H. Haas Regen

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am aware of and great upset about criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County.  These atrocities against innocent animals must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

How can law enforcement turn a blind eye to this?  Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.  Help these innocent animals, do not betray them.

Regards,

Lisa Cassell, CPA
Fort Worth, TX

Some people who received this message don't often get email from kirstenfriche@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing to express my deep concern regarding the ongoing criminal animal abuse occurring at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. It is imperative that this matter is addressed and stopped immediately. For many decades, Ridglan Farms has been involved in breeding dogs for the purpose of brutal experiments. During this time, numerous instances of violations of state animal cruelty laws have been documented, including:

- Performing surgical mutilations on dogs without the use of anesthetics or the presence of veterinarians.
- Keeping dogs confined in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, which has led to severe psychological trauma.
- Providing improper flooring and housing conditions, resulting in foot injuries and infections, particularly among puppies.

Despite these clear violations, it is disheartening to see that instead of prosecuting Ridglan Farms for these offenses, the authorities have chosen to prosecute individuals who have attempted to rescue these mistreated dogs. This situation is unacceptable. I urge you to take immediate action to stop the abuse and ensure that Ridglan Farms is held accountable for their actions. The thousands of dogs suffering in your county deserve protection and justice. Please prioritize prosecuting Ridglan Farms for their criminal activities rather than those who seek to rescue and care for these animals.

Respectfully,
Kirsten Friche

Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws many times:
● Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
● Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological
trauma for the dogs
● Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. The breeder is to be held to state laws and their AAALAC International accreditation - it seems they may be in violation of both.


Ridglan has been accused of violating state animal cruelty laws and their accreditation through the following:

  *   - Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   - Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   - Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

I urge you to take these claims seriously, as medical testing breeders need to uphold a standard. This maintains professionalism within the field and reduces scrutiny from those whom disagree with the use of animals in medical research.


If diving into the matter deems the above true, please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse.  Ensure Ridglan Farms loses their accreditation and prosecute their state crimes accordingly.

Respectfully,


Hayley Kinard

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Animals should not have to endure this type of torture, nor should anyone be doing this to an animal. Please have a heart and do something for the people.




Respectfully,


Samantha Ostler

Good afternoon Attorney Ozanne,


The following is a template email that exercises the thoughts of many, however I would seek to add that both the use and keeping of animals for any experimentation - medical or otherwise - is both against the rights of other living beings, cruel beyond measure and, with the advent of new technologies, now fundamentally unnecessary. Please look to the future, hold those culpable of malpractice to account and advocate in the strongest possible terms for a future free of animals testing and torture.


Thank you.


Further,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

Dear Sir,

Please can you stop the breeding of animals for experimentation at Ridglan? It is truly an evil place for animals, along with many others like them.

In our 21st century, no animal should be suffering at the hands of man, anywhere in the world. Experimentation on animals is very poor at finding human cures. Digital and technological means is 100% accurate. Why then, is America, a supposedly civilised country, along with other, supposedly, civilised countries not using digital methods, causing no suffering at all?

Why then, are animals suffering incarceration in hideous surroundings, being experimented upon constantly, being bred for the purposes of experimentation and living dismal lives? If sentient humans then feel and see their suffering, rescue them from hellish lives, they are arrested and dragged through the courts, only then for cases to be dropped by these horribly wealthy companies because they don't want intrusion and investigations into the cruel experiments conducted and the horrid lives animals suffer.

As human beings, we need sentience toward every animal on the planet. They're all precious and need our help and support when being exploited by humans for profit and gain. They are not ours to abuse, profit from and exploit. They deserve a good, enjoyable life, as humans do.

Lawmakers need to stop rescuers of all animals being dragged through the courts. Abusers should be, but not rescuers. In 2024 humans should be treating animals as equals shouldn't they?

Thank you for reading my email.

Yours sincerely,
S H Challenger (Mrs)

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Clearly you have enough to press charges. Please don’t wait anymore. Didn’t you take this job to help control crime?




Respectfully,

Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue. Just because dogs are not humans does not mean they should have no protection and rights.

Respectfully,

Mariam Shah-Rais

District Attorney Ozanne,

 I am writing to express my concerns regarding the ongoing criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which urgently needs to be addressed and halted.

For decades, the company has been breeding dogs for cruel experiments, consistently violating state animal cruelty laws. These violations include surgical mutilations performed without anesthesia or veterinary oversight, confinement of dogs in small metal cages often in solitary conditions leading to psychological trauma, and inadequate flooring and housing resulting in foot injuries and infections in puppies.

 Rather than holding Ridglan accountable for these egregious offenses, it appears that your office has chosen to prosecute those who attempt to rescue these suffering animals.

I urge you to redirect your efforts and prosecute Ridglan Farms for their clear violations of animal welfare laws.

Thousands of dogs in your county are enduring criminal abuse, and it is imperative that action is taken to ensure justice and protection for these innocent animals.

 Respectfully,

Ruxanda Balan

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

As a Bay Area college student with aspirations to become a veterinarian, and a dedicated volunteer at my local animal shelter, I am deeply troubled by the ongoing reports of animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County.

The violations of state animal cruelty laws, including surgical procedures without proper anesthetics, confinement in small cages causing psychological trauma, and inadequate housing leading to injupries and infections, are deeply concerning to me.

I am committed to advocating for every animal that is being abused, and I urge you to prioritize the well-being of these innocent animals by taking decisive action against Ridglan Farms. It is disheartening to hear that rescuers are being prosecuted instead of the perpetrators. Please reconsider this approach and support the efforts of those who are working tirelessly to rescue and care for these mistreated animals.

Thank you for your attention to this critical issue. I trust that you will do what is right for the voiceless animals who rely on our protection.

Sincerely,

Angelina Harris

District Attorney Ozanne,


The fact that criminal animal abuse is taking place at Ridglan Farms has come to my attention far from Dane County, on which it poorly reflects. As there has been quite some evidence presented, it's hard to understand why these crimes have not been addressed. Over many decades, the company has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Anyone who has ever had a family dog knows all this is wrong, and we depend on our law enforcement officials to stop criminal behavior. I would expect prosecution of Ridglan farms for any and all laws they break, and request that they be forced to comply with US federal and Wisconsin state law.


Respectfully,


A. Baer

Brooklyn, NY

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,


Sent from my T-Mobile 5G Device

District Attorney Coda,


I hope you’re well.


I am writing because I am really worried that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and ended. For decades, the company has been cruelly breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been seen to have blatantly ignored state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present (unthinkable)

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

With respect, it deeply saddens me that Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, it seems you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs, who honestly are just showing a strong understanding of virtue ethics. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure more criminal abuse. I don’t really understand why this is happening. Please, Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully with very best wishes,

Bronwen


Some people who received this message don't often get email from martin.rottau@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing to express my grave concerns regarding the ongoing issue of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. For decades, this company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments, in clear violation of state animal cruelty laws. These violations include performing surgical procedures without proper anesthesia or veterinary supervision, subjecting animals to confinement in cramped metal cages leading to severe psychological distress, and maintaining inadequate housing conditions resulting in injuries and infections among the puppies.

Rather than holding Ridglan Farms accountable for these egregious offenses, it has come to my attention that your office has chosen to prosecute individuals who have attempted to rescue these suffering animals. I implore you to prioritize the welfare of thousands of dogs in your county and take decisive legal action against Ridglan Farms, instead of targeting those who seek to protect these innocent creatures.


I know it easy to follow the rules and the system, but what do you want to look back on in the future. that YOU ignored thousands of dogs lives that needed YOUR help or that YOU helped thousands of innocent dogs?
And what would you want others to do if you were in their position?

Respectfully,

Rottau

If you are not the intended recipient, please destroy all copies and inform the sender by return e-mail. Internet e-mail is not a secure medium. Any reply to this message could be intercepted and read by someone else. Please bear that in mind when deciding whether to send material in response to this message by e-mail. This e-mail (whether you are the sender or the recipient) may be monitored, recorded and retained by the Ministry of Justice. Monitoring / blocking software may be used, and e-mail content may be read at any time. District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Dogs give us complete trust and loyalty. They help us in many ways such as guide dogs and police dogs which gives the dogs an excellent quality of life and the relationships with humans that they need. Using these gentle intelligent animals for experiments is both  both inhumane and totally unnecessary. Humans do not respond to things in the same way as dogs do, so anything tested on animals has to be retested on humans.

Please ensure that all cruelty is stopped and give these beautiful creatures the life they deserve.

Thank you so much

Respectfully

Julie Preston

I am writing to you regarding criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County that needs to be addressed and stopped. For many years, the company has bred dogs for brutal experiments. During this time, Ridglan has been violating state animal cruelty laws, such as (to name a few):


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

You don't often get email from jdhrn@sbcglobal.net. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

I am writing because I have concerns about horrific cruelty and criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Please prosecute Ridglan for these offenses, not the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

Jody Hansell RN

________________________________
From: Eileen Gibson
Sent: 18 March 2024 17:52
To: ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov <ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov>
Subject: Ridglan Farms in Dane County


District Attorney Ozanne,


My reason for writing is that I am genuinely concerned that allegations of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County have been made that must be addressed and stopped.


The company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments over many years.   During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present;

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs;

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.


I believe that Ridglan should be prosecuted for these allegations, if proved.


The general public cannot bear the thought of animal abuse and suffering to be ongoing at all.  Animal experimentation is being challenged owing to its failure to show efficacy and there are now better non-animal ways.  Please therefore, if there is animal abuse occurring at Ridglan, can you use your power and prosecute?  The rescuers are acting according to their consciences and are morally, good people and should never be prosecuted for that.


Yours sincerely,



Eileen Gibson

Hi Christine,

I'm writing to you from Madison, Wisconsin where dozens of animal advocates are currently demonstrating outside the Dane County District Attorney's Office, calling for charges to be filed against Ridglan Farms, one of the last remaining beagle factory farms in the US. Inside this facility, DxE investigators have documented dogs crammed into small cages, often alone, with no access to the outdoors; noxious air and feces building up beneath the cages; dogs with red and swollen feet from standing on wire cage floors; and dogs showing signs of extreme psychological torment like spinning endlessly in circles and bouncing off the cage walls.

On March 8, the District Attorney dropped all charges<http://url4133.mail.directactioneverywhere.com/ls/click?upn=u001.71uDLRXpj34gONlqvUsU-2BMqs3fbe0qOX1Pk-2Bx4OqbUUAl8RlFWmiV-2BVP3hOaIDHsXPmj7b4N-2B2tykEZrQwRhNjJfp8pJzH68msAhBnjrvqXd66W4rTNpDRrsSqgzSjf6y-2B3HKPvpUGKsvit3OIvIYi-2BKbFUIzd2rljfT9N2iZCP-2Fm6DPEvhTPi2hsAZ0NdxEyx0G_dIkUTa8jGc02McqirfJIFKzZL2-2FtZGJhmVZkvoxUYUqxhJIZlixyLZK3OVfK63qYMmDDXP-2BHFvQJi7ak-2FLWb2ysPaSJmGXW6haUGCDPssxiw55oYprntdOO5K5JrJUzh-2Ffv46shaYnHZ4CE-2Bl1Vhsix8hGcaq4F541AYFRZNaFCqBCRfvQeuID89itoCPomLIglT5JS7EtIeF6vW7hkUuZrZw642-2BqM3siRdlr3FO-2BaEhyUKCEjJA57uCDyiubD3aKHjXyz5Efd-2FfTtLWu3nh72OuGG9cKjDTsfbPSq4kYDNnwn8h1GhDq2suGDKqi4kjYF9oAUDSlylffmcaG5uP46ZKZFIQ2yfbj-2BcO4lY8TVyWz1ggAJunl-2B2-2BggCYKJITRB6n8UpMhTW652mtNqxLVAdW-2Bvs0foEtnTKluJ4vSbNUCFg0xsiYDJ5OHn4jDTPM3BEdmNNJVc4-2BK8RRNodmwasYso1TYp6nUH56iQOye86DY5lWBAs9gC8ZksVK7MqJPv5ofrKiCpqiuwL0a0AhAFQDZvas3mh4ZWl11B-2FlMPk2dYmBp-2FBtYz4JdY4tegGKagvjjijtvjfDiag3V-2Bzsp-2FrpHgZo-2B7uvGREz-2BTGEaWitrY2YyONZQhFOFZHh2G3-2F36Kd1FroCYUaHGwylH8DaGR6kdcACpYUfnUFoYRfgNhlHhmD0N1hZJfNeboZfuFZ-2BmHsPfq17ULoZV-2FFMwF7hoFW4un4RcYpNiyB6xE3u9pYPVFr4-2BpDBqNNJB8jyM1MnpaWqwUMh5rRcGT1WJ7kwZvtuLyZWaEerbVaQ6cCe6cqswAOOXKCitiJx2r9kFltqm08ssQc3Og8C-2BoF-2BOnNzNwZUSY0ENICQpQ-2BY-2B-2BlbF5JFkeMQl5e60c-2F30u2CfTLonv56Ftbvr8VA27IEWcp-2BDMNGMVuGWPfc8yAiQSYdg77l21t6B9UE2oKOXLUZLN> against three people who were involved in a DxE investigation and open rescue at Ridglan Farms in 2017. While this is a small win for the Right to Rescue (and a sign that public pressure works!), it is also a clear attempt to cover up animal cruelty that would have been exposed in court. Ridglan Farms admitted to the media<http://url4133.mail.directactioneverywhere.com/ls/click?upn=u001.71uDLRXpj34gONlqvUsU-2BDT20M1NNDlNXjk7Hl-2BCteNckmCoEv0h0VtHsPBO1yMsnuiLnCuBjA8YnzfMi4M1PQ6qXAgIc4ov5TcrAmoNIX8G-2BNaghK3I-2Bkt5t2pZGRfjXbTBCMhgo0lgSmeme9zc3TJENvyijaHf7xXq6-2B0bVNhTenyko-2Fbf6ZM-2FKMDX9HwlJVr499N3V4U7e7pUpRcR2mghuXDXcprYpbyhxNdQ-2BfmG0Frpb-2BURhlgxlXJmCDdImhSZVW5pSsuRfk6T7vSYcc3tsh6kVX1vbB7yxoTC7d4-3DRjLV_dIkUTa8jGc02McqirfJIFKzZL2-2FtZGJhmVZkvoxUYUqxhJIZlixyLZK3OVfK63qYMmDDXP-2BHFvQJi7ak-2FLWb2ysPaSJmGXW6haUGCDPssxiw55oYprntdOO5K5JrJUzh-2Ffv46shaYnHZ4CE-2Bl1Vhsix8hGcaq4F541AYFRZNaFCqBCRfvQeuID89itoCPomLIglT5JS7EtIeF6vW7hkUuZrZw642-2BqM3siRdlr3FO-2BaEhyUKCEjJA57uCDyiubD3aKHjXyz5Efd-2FfTtLWu3nh72OuGG9cKjDTsfbPSq4kYDNnwn8h1GhDq2suGDKqi4kjYF9oAUDSlylffmcaG5uP46ZKZFIQ2yfbj-2BcO4lY8TVyWz1ggAJunl-2B2-2BggCYKJITRB6n8UpMhTW652mtNqxLVAdW-2Bvs0foEtnTKluJ4vSbNUCFg0xsiYDJ5OHn4jDTPM3BEdmNNJVc4-2BK8RRNodmwasYso1TYp6nUH56iQOye86DY5lWBAs9gC8ZksVK7MqJPv5ofrKiCpqiuwL0a0AhAFQDZvas3mh4ZWl11B-2FlMPk2dYmBp-2FBtYz4JdY4tegGKagvjjijtvjfDiag3V-2Bzsp-2FrpHgZo-2B7uvGREz-2BTGEaWitrY2YyONZQhFOFZHh2G3-2F36Kd1FroCYUaHGwylH8DaGR6kdcACpYUfnUFoYRfgNhlHhmD0N1hZJfNeboZfuFZ-2BmHsPfq17ULoZV-2FFMwF7hoFW4un4RcYpNiyB6xE3u9pYPVFr4-2BpDBqNNJB8jyM17dnjIGmdMmswIjObgfzxu7t-2FjqPLFBZ2WAQDbpkKI1MnKZtCK38OlSCr-2BkldTEQ-2BGn3Bsxm-2FPPtOmp-2FgRn1r6G8GrrOd5ds7M4Hz4-2FXLY9wlaoMd7du5xY0IeG0Xwch7hsOydvnuN4v9oq1Bgxp0DZFDWcFxnag0x-2FUOp7AHCITVYSrUVvCxB9igZRC6nwIW> that they wanted the case dismissed because "In the weeks leading up to the trial, we observed the public spectacle being planned by animal research opposition groups across the country." They wanted us to stay home and stay silent. Instead, we're coming together and raising our voices all week to demand justice for the dogs abused by Ridglan. And you can help!

Some people who received this message don't often get email from ginni.hawkinson@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
I see the charges have been dropped which is encouraging, however animal abuse and cruelty is still ongoing at Ridglan Farms. There should be further action and investigation into their practices and I hope that some action will be taken going forward.

Best
Virginia


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Ginni Hawkinson <ginni.hawkinson@gmail.com<mailto:ginni.hawkinson@gmail.com>>
Date: Wed, May 22, 2024, 10:19 AM
Subject: Concerns regarding Ridglan Farms
To: <ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov<mailto:ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov>>, <danecoda@da.wi.gov<mailto:danecoda@da.wi.gov>>



District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue. It's the right thing to do!!!


Sincerely

Virginia Bailey


Some people who received this message don't often get email from flamolly@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Please see the attached message I have sent to D.A. Ozanne. The public is deeply concerned about the abuses happening at Ridglan farms.

Thank you.
Molly Flanagan


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Molly Flanagan <flamolly@gmail.com<mailto:flamolly@gmail.com>>
Date: Tue, Mar 19, 2024 at 5:57 PM
Subject: Criminal Cruelty Against Dogs at Ridglan
To: <ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov<mailto:ismael.ozanne@da.wi.gov>>



District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing to express deep concerns about abuses at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. This company has been breeding dogs for experiments for too long. Disturbing violations against Beagles have been documented there, including:


  *   Surgeries without painkillers done without veterinarians

  *   Physical separation from other dogs

  *   Ongoing confinement in small metal cages

  *   Psychological trauma and stereotypical behavior like spinning

  *   Foot injuries and infections caused by flooring/housing


It appears that you are prosecuting rescuers instead of prosecuting Ridglan. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. This is traumatic for everyone, especially the dogs.


Thank you for your urgent attention to this dire situation,

Molly Flanagan

Some people who received this message don't often get email from creepystocker@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
 Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

I hope this letter finds you well. I am reaching out to express my concerns regarding what I believe to be serious instances of criminal animal abuse occurring at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which I feel require urgent attention and action.

For many years, it has come to light that Ridglan Farms has been engaged in the breeding of dogs for experiments, a practice that has raised significant ethical and legal questions. During this period, there have been multiple observations suggesting that the facility has not adhered to state animal cruelty laws, including but not limited to:

- Performing surgical procedures without the use of anesthetics or the supervision of qualified veterinarians.
- Housing dogs in small, metal cages for extended periods, often in isolation, which can lead to severe psychological distress.
- Utilizing improper flooring and housing conditions that have resulted in foot injuries and infections among the puppies.

It has come to my understanding that, rather than taking legal action against Ridglan Farms for these alleged offenses, efforts have instead been focused on prosecuting individuals who have attempted to rescue these animals.

I respectfully urge you to reconsider the approach taken towards Ridglan Farms and to prioritize the welfare of the thousands of dogs allegedly affected by these practices. It is my sincere hope that through your leadership, effective measures will be taken to address and halt these concerning activities.

Thank you for your time and consideration of this matter.

Yours sincerely,

Jordan

I think it is admirable you have decided to drop the charges against those who rescued suffering animals from Ridglan Farms.

I have spent 5 years of my life completing a PhD which would give me a 6 figure salary in a pharmaceutical company. However the cruelty with which animals experiments are run in this industry is repulsive and I am only completing my PhD for posterity as this point, with no desire to pursue a career in this perverted field.

If these experiments which are run every day on animals were run on humans in the modern day, even if for the "greater good", no one would stand for it. And yet we dont extend this mercy to other living beings, who are sentient, feel physical and emotional pains, even though these are the qualities which merit kindness and compassion to fellow humans.

I deeply admire your office taking a stand for kindness instead of siding with the corporate dollar. The world is a slightly less dark place now thanks to you.

Christopher Corbo

I'm writing to express serious concerns that criminal animal cruelty at Ridglan Farms in Dane County is not being tackled. For many years the company has been breeding dogs for experimentation purposes and during that time Ridglan has been witnessed contravening state laws relating to animal abuse. These include...


  *   Surgical procedures without pain relief and without any veterinary professionals being present

  *   Confinement (often solitary) in small metal cages, which leads to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Inadequate and improper flooring and housing, leading directly to causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Yet, instead of prosecuting Ridglan for such offences, you have prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs.

You should not be letting any animals in your county to have criminal abuse inflicted on them.

It's time to do your job and prosecute Ridglan farms, not the animal rescuers.

Certainly, here is the revised text with the emphasized characteristics:

"Across the planet, the movement to shut down facilities that breed animals for laboratory experiments is growing. I have decided to write because I have deep concerns that the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be halted. The dogs bred by this company for experimentation endure brutalities, some are beaten, subjected to all sorts of diseases. This violence and neglect violate the principles of animal welfare. Ridglan Farms has flagrantly violated several state laws:

- Performing surgical mutilations without the presence of anesthetics or veterinarians;
- Confining animals in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to severe psychological trauma for the dogs;
- Providing improper flooring and housing, causing injuries to their feet and infections in puppies.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these violations, you have targeted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to suffer criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan Farms, not the animal rescuers.

We are in the 21st century, and various forms of laboratory testing have been developed that do not involve violence against sentient, social beings who have feelings and express them. In fact, the violence inflicted on animals in laboratories is not in line with science. It does not progress, and the response of an animal cannot be compared to that of a human being. At the very least, it is BAD (in every sense) science, involving mistreatment, deprivation, and death of animals.

Let us be rational and just!
Let us be compassionate!
Building a better world depends on our actions.
Please, do the right thing. Close down this hell called Ridglan Farms.
Thank you!
Respectfully,
Renato da Costa"

Some people who received this message don't often get email from heather.joanne.allen@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Dear District Attorney Ozzane,

I am a Madison resident and I served for 6 years as the Legislative Analyst for the Madison Common Council. In that role, you and I had a chance to collaborate on an anti-gun violence initiative.  I enjoyed the opportunity to meet you through that process.

I have recently been made aware of a Class A purpose bred beagle dealer in Dane County, called Ridglan Farms, which has roughly 3000 dogs on site. A private pet owner would be charged with animal abuse. We must hold this facility responsible for the crimes they are committing.  I am grateful that the charges against the activists who brought this situation to light have been dropped recently, but the on-going issues at the facility must be addressed.

A similar facility, Envigo in Virginia, was closed after members of Congress expressed concerns about the USDA's failure to enforce the Animal Welfare Act. It took public outcry and lawmakers outside the USDA to expose that facility and the inhumane conditions and neglect. A similar type of investigation needs to be considered for the Ridglan facility in our own backyard.

I understand the complexities of the issue of using animals for research, but we must do better. It is my understanding that this facility falls under regulation of both the USDA, as well as Wisconsin DATCP.  Inspections by state and federal inspectors observed many concerning conditions including: Many adult dogs stacked in cages with mesh flooring, dogs not being removed from enclosure for exercise, dogs not provided any outdoor enclosures, several dogs being treated for health problems, many dogs displaying prominent stereotypical behaviors (circling, pacing, wall bouncing) -- symptoms of severe stress.  What is unclear is how this facility continues to operate with impunity with noted violations that have continued over many years.

Dane County is a leader on many important matters--we cannot allow these innocent animals to suffer in inhumane conditions.  I ask you to please consider an independent investigation of Ridglan Farms.

Sincerely,

Heather Allen

District Attorney Ozanne,


Advocating for animals is not a criminal offense! I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

 VETERINARIANS OATH:

            “Being admitted to the profession of veterinary medicine, I solemnly swear to use my scientific knowledge and skills for the benefit of society through the protection of animal health and welfare, the prevention and relief of animal suffering, the conservation of animal resources, the promotion of public health, and the advancement of medical knowledge.

I will practice my profession conscientiously, with dignity, and in keeping with the principles of veterinary medical ethics.

I accept as a lifelong obligation the continual improvement of my professional knowledge and competence.”


It is unlawful for any person to perform any medical or surgical procedures such as the one performed at Ridglan Farms without a veterinarian license. If any individuals that are or not licensed who work there did any of these acts or knew about them, they should immediately be terminated and justice should be brought upon these innocent dogs. As known these beagles are used for experimentation, which is supposed to be used for the greater good of the species, I say- supposed to be. Any experiments done on any animal is pain enduring. These beagles endured painful procedures without any anesthesia. This should still be considered as they are creatures who still sees, thinks, feels, and still loves. As a veterinarian technician and being able to be the voice of animals for those who cannot speak, I must say that the acts committed there were, and are, truly utterly disgusting and no animal should have to go through a torturous event such as described from various pieces of information on this subject. I have seen enough information on this, and for the sake of these helpless dogs, please investigate thoroughly and again give justice to the dogs at this in this place that’s untruthfully a “Right to Rescue”. Take consideration and help them. Do not let them mutilate these dogs no further and take action to truly for once rescue these souls.

Respectfully, Kitana Siverly

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing from the UK because I am shocked that animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County has been allowed to take place.


It seems animal welfare inspectors have been doing nothing to stop the abuse. The inspectors must have witnessed over many decades, that Ridglan Farms has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, it seems Ridglan has been observed by their own staff and others violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anaesthetics or veterinarians present.
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs.
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan Farms for these offences, Dane County has prosecuted the rescuers of some of these dogs. The rescuers clearly applied compassionate morality to save imprisoned, vulnerable dogs in the absence of action by the Authorities.


Please do not let down humane citizens in Dane County or those watching around the world. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Please prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescuers.


Respectfully,


Chess Wood

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. I realize you feel that since they are an incorporated business and are working in conjunction with a lab, not the one committing testing that you seem to think they’re above the laws reach, or that they are within legal means, but sadly they work in direct conjunction with a facility that commits crimes that are not with in legal range. Just by affiliating themselves with these companies they’ve established themselves as accomplices and by protecting them and not investigating further and charging them with the abuse they’ve committed you have now established yourself as an accomplice to heinous crimes. In a court of law the driver of the car goes down with the shooter, and that analogy can be applied to this circumstance as well. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies
  *   Left dogs alone unattended for long periods of time without any surpervision and it is well known that they have pregnant dogs in their facility and that is just not acceptable.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue. If this persists, I will set up a party and a hands on organization in USA to protest and advocate for these animals in person on the front lines. I will bring social media awareness to crimes being done here and I am well within my civil rights to protest and do as such. Please do not allow the narrative of your county to crumble for supporting these treacheries, or your political standpoint to be tarnished because the public feels that you lack humility and basic civility.  I am attaching a picture of my sweet boy whom lives at home with me, my cats, our bird and ferrets and loves and play with them all. He would never hurt a fly. I hope you can look at his face and maybe scrape up some empathy for other animals besides yourself. Have a fabulous day and do consider this.

Respectfully,

Sierra Thompson

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,


Kelly Brzeski

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County is taking place and must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, and I don't understand why these laws are not being enforced by your office.  What is the point of having laws and then ignoring individuals or companies breaking of these laws.  Here are examples:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. This is selective law enforcement and not justice.  Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

District Attorney Ozanne,

    I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped immediately! Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   1. Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   2. Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   3. Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

   This is not to say that in my view or the publics’, animal experimentation would be ethical by any means if they were treated slightly less worse. Not in the slightest.



   Animal experimentation does not translate well to humans for example if we were trying to see if a lipstick would be safe for humans to use. It is only 90% accurate at most. We have developed human cells in a petri dish, we should use this, instead of hurting animals as it is unethical and unnecessarily.


    These dogs have emotions and are incredibly intelligent, empathetic, trusting and forgiving  beings. This is exactly why they are using them brutal experiments.


   Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Do not let this barbaric cruelty, this cruel betrayal of the dogs’ trust slide!

Respectfully,


Francis Szabo

[Some people who received this message don't often get email from learshadow@gmail.com. Learn why this is important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ]

Dear DA Ozanne,

My name is James Cromwell. I am an actor and an animal rights advocate, and I am writing to ask you to prosecute Ridglan Farms for criminal animal cruelty.

At the Ridglan breeding facility, dogs endure cruel and inhumane conditions. Their cages are so small that they exhibit what experts call stereotypic behavior, meaning that they spin in circles constantly, bounce off of the walls, and bark frantically. This is an indication that they are experiencing extreme psychological and physical distress. They also suffer from exposure to constant light, even at night, and consistent foot injuries due to inadequate floor structures. They have been subjected to amateur surgeries performed without pain killers. All of this is clearly a violation of animal cruelty laws.

And if that's not enough, the Ridglan dogs ultimately end up being sold to laboratories for unnecessary experiments, such as being made to have strokes for hours on end (with high mortality rates), being force fed laundry detergent until they vomit blood and die, and being infected with diseases and parasites.

Other enforcement agencies are inadequate to address this problem. For instance, the USDA does not meaningfully enforce the Animal Welfare Act. But you have the power to help these innocent creatures by enforcing the law and prosecuting their abusers. Gentle beagles love humans unconditionally, and it's unthinkable that we repay them by torturing them in this way. Criminal animal cruelty of this kind must end. Please prosecute Ridglan Farms.

With Gratitude,
James Cromwell

I'm writing because I'm extremely disturbed and concerned about what seems to be extreme animal cruelty happening to thousands (!) of beagle dogs at the Ridglan Farm in Blue Mounds.

I'd like to see proof that these dogs are being treated well- or even better that this facility is shut down immediately.
It's unacceptable a "farm" like this can exist anywhere and I would like to think decision makers at Dane County would not allow a place like this to operate.

Please do something to protect these poor dogs.

Carissa Wegner
Madison, WI

You don't often get email from joanne.waguespack@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
I'm writing to you about Madison, Wisconsin where dozens of animal advocates are currently demonstrating outside the Dane County District Attorney's Office, calling for charges to be filed against Ridglan Farms, one of the last remaining beagle factory farms in the US. Inside this facility, DxE investigators have documented dogs crammed into small cages, often alone, with no access to the outdoors; noxious air and feces building up beneath the cages; dogs with red and swollen feet from standing on wire cage floors; and dogs showing signs of extreme psychological torment like spinning endlessly in circles and bouncing off the cage walls.
Riddled Farms should be shut down. This is animal cruelty.
Please help these animals.

Joanne Waguespack

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

I am a Milwaukee, Wisconsin resident and former legislative aide to congressman Jim Moody. I am very concerned about the conditions and animal cruelty witnessed at the beagle factory farm, Ridglan Farms near Madison, WI. And in light of the newest information regarding animal, cruelty there, I urge your office to investigate this business.

Many people will be working to pass legislation in the state of Wisconsin to ban medical experimentation on dogs outright. In the interim, investigating this business, their practices and the cruelty that exists is going to be a very important step, and we do not take it lightly. Of course, animals cannot speak on their own behalf, and they have no political ties making them especially more vulnerable.

Some people who received this message don't often get email from dmkt2424@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>


District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Your Name

District Attorney Ozanne,

Humans arrogantly call ourselves homo “sapiens” (the “wise” species) while being the most cruel on the planet.

I am deeply concerned that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County had not been stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, including:

- Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
- Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
- Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Urgently and Respectfully,
Diana Spencer

You don't often get email from mirais.holden@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

Dear DA Ozanne,

I’m an attorney, and I’m writing to respectfully urge you to prosecute criminal animal cruelty to beagle dogs taking place at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. Your office has received many reports about cruelty at Ridglan over the years but has so far declined to prosecute Ridglan. In fact, your office has prosecuted rescuers who saved dogs from Ridglan, but the charges have now been dropped. That makes this a good time to prosecute the decades-long abuse at Ridglan, including:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confining dogs in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma, as evidenced by stereotypic behavior
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Please decide that your office will finally do something about this. Thousands of gentle dogs are counting on you as their only hope.


Many thanks,

Mirais Holden, Esq.



Mirais M. Holden

To:

District Attorney Ismael Ozanne,

Dane County, Wisconsin.

Dear Sir,

Thousands of beagles are trapped in cages, waiting to be tortured in cruel and useless experiments by Ridglan Farms.

Criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped as soon as possible.

This company is infamous for breeding dogs for brutal and senseless experiments for decades.

During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs.

Please do not allow thousands of innocent, friendly dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescuers!

Thank you,

Sincerely,
Chantal Buslot Belgium

Are you planning to do anything about
the criminal animal cruelty taking place at Ridglan Farms? It’s a breeder of beagles sold for animal experiments. Investigations have documented instances of surgical mutilations, cruel

Michelle Setaro

for their atrocities against innocent animals!

[cid:04e9cfc7-6202-42c8-9a82-bbc96d0f7606]

KARMA: WHAT WE DO TO THE ANIMALS WE DO TO OURSELVES

"If I am to be a voice for the animals, how should I speak? Am I to whisper, when they are screaming in pain? Am I to be calm when they tremble in fear? Am I to shout for mercy, when their throats are being slit? Tell me how I need to speak, for you to grant them their freedom.” - Davegan Raza

"The animals are sending us a message, that they are not our food, and that we are violating laws of nature." ~ Dr. Michael Klaper

"We must not refuse to see with our eyes, what they must endure with their bodies." ~ Gretchen Wyler

"In their behavior toward creatures, all men are Nazis. Human beings see oppression vividly when they're the victims. Otherwise they victimize blindly and without a thought." ~ Isaac Bashevis Singer, author, Nobel Prize 1978

"We patronize the animals for their incompleteness, for their tragic fate of having taken form so far below ourselves. And therein we err, and greatly err. For the animal shall not be measured by man. In a world older and more complete than ours, they are more finished and complete, gifted with extensions of the senses we have lost or never attained, living by voices we shall never hear. They are not brethren, they are not underlings; they are other Nations, caught with ourselves in the net of life and time." ~ Henry Beston

"It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends upon his not understanding it." ~ Upton Sinclair

http://www.nationearth.com/
https://www.dominionmovement.com/watch
http://vimeo.com/26718309




Some people who received this message don't often get email from katherine.m.winter@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I am reaching out to express my deep concerns regarding the ongoing issue of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms within Dane County, an urgent matter that demands immediate action. For many years, this establishment has been breeding dogs to conduct harsh experiments. Throughout this period, numerous instances of state animal cruelty law violations by Ridglan have been documented, including:

  *   They perform surgical procedures on animals without using anesthetics or the oversight of qualified veterinarians.
  *   They are subjecting dogs to confinement in cramped metal cages, often in isolation, which has resulted in significant psychological harm.
  *   They provide inadequate flooring and living conditions, leading to foot injuries and infections among the puppies.


Regrettably, rather than taking legal action against Ridglan for these violations, efforts have been directed toward prosecuting individuals who have attempted to rescue these dogs. I implore you to shift the focus of legal actions toward prosecuting Ridglan Farms to prevent the further suffering of thousands of dogs in your jurisdiction.


Please prosecute Ridglan now! Dogs are man's best friend. They deserve better than this.



Best regards,

--

Katherine Winter

650-793-7245

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   - Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   - Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   - Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I am very concerned about the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has consistently violated Wisconsin animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse.


Please prosecute Ridglan Farms rather than going after activists who have the well being of animals at heart.


Respectfully,


Jennifer Ferrarese

Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal, cruel experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

- Surgical mutilation without anesthetics or veterinarians present (this should not be accepted even with anesthesia)
- Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
- Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Some people who received this message don't often get email from alegracia@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing to you today with a heavy heart, compelled by a deep sense of compassion and a firm belief in justice for all living beings.

The revelations of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County have shaken me to my core. For far too long, this company has operated with impunity, subjecting innocent animals to unimaginable suffering in the name of profit and experimentation.

The accounts of surgical mutilations without proper anesthesia or veterinary care, the confinement of dogs in cramped and solitary conditions, and the neglectful housing practices leading to painful injuries and infections in vulnerable puppies are nothing short of horrifying.

What troubles me even more is the apparent lack of action from your office to hold Ridglan Farms accountable for these egregious violations of state animal cruelty laws. Instead, it is deeply troubling to learn that those who have bravely stepped forward to rescue these animals have faced prosecution themselves.

As someone who holds a profound love for animals and a steadfast commitment to doing what is right, I implore you to reconsider your approach. The moral imperative to protect the innocent and vulnerable among us, regardless of species, cannot be ignored or brushed aside.

I urge you, District Attorney Ozanne, to stand on the side of compassion and justice. Prosecute Ridglan Farms for their crimes against these voiceless creatures. Let us not allow thousands of dogs to suffer in silence any longer.

Respectfully,

Sofia Gracia
# (210) 238-0722

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Katheryn Pilkerton

Hello,

I am concerned about the rampant and criminal animal abuse that has been documented at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. Over many decades, Ridglan Farms has been breeding dogs for horrific and brutal experiments - during that time Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

-Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
-Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
-Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

It is extremely disturbing to me that instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have prosecuted the rescuers who have shown only kindness to these dogs. Why? Have you never loved a dog or any other innocent animal?

I adopted a rescue beagle 5 years ago - the sweetest and silliest little guy! Beagles are often “used” in animal experimentation precisely because of their sweet, docile and submissive temperaments. Please do not continue to allow thousands of beagles in your county to endure sadistic and criminal abuse: prosecute Ridglan Farms, not Animal Rescuers.

Respectfully,

Lillian Koponen

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped.


The FDA Modernization Act 2.0 makes it no longer necessary to test on animals to get products released to the public market. Also, the results of animal testing are worse at predicting outcomes in humans than flipping a coin. For these reasons, it makes zero sense for these places to still exist. It's old cruel science and these dogs are suffering needlessly and illegally.


Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Brandon Driscoll-Luttringer

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse is happening at Ridglan Farms in Dane County and must be addressed and stopped.   *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies
