  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Please look at some of the footage and information on what has been going on at these Farms. In a civilized country, such as the US, this cannot continue. These dogs are sentient beings and suffer tremendously.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,
Sasha Corcashvili

Ground floor flat
16 Ivy Crescent
London W4 5NG

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I have grave concerns regarding the criminal animal abuse occuring at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. I strongly believe these abuses must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

Some people who received this message don't often get email from salabb0212@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
District Attorney Ozanne,


I am reaching out to express my deep concerns regarding ongoing instances of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. It's troubling to note that despite numerous reports and evidence of wrongdoing, the company continues to operate unchecked.

Some of the reported violations include surgical procedures performed without proper anesthesia or veterinary oversight, confinement of animals in small, solitary metal cages leading to severe psychological distress, and inadequate housing conditions resulting in injuries and infections among the animals, particularly puppies.

What is concerning is that instead of taking action against Ridglan Farms for these egregious violations of animal cruelty laws, there have been instances where those attempting to rescue and bring attention to these issues have faced legal repercussions.

It is imperative that swift and decisive action be taken to address and rectify these grave injustices. I urge you to prioritize the welfare and protection of these animals by prosecuting Ridglan Farms for their actions, rather than penalizing those advocating for their well-being.

Respectfully, Sally

Hi Ismael,

I'm reaching out because I'm frustrated that you haven't prosecuted Ridglan Farms for blatant animal cruelty. There's plenty of evidence available. These dogs go through physical and psychological torture - It is animal cruelty. Why are we allowed to break windows to save dogs in cars but not able to save dogs being mutilated, living in their own feces with infections, with no exposure to sun and the outside world?

It was also cruel that you let the charges against Paul Darwin Picklesimer, Wayne Hsiung and Eva Hamer go on for ~2-3 years, then dismissed it last minute to avoid negative PR for Ridglan Farms. It's hard to believe in a just system when things like this happen to keep cruelty in the dark and corporations get to avoid responsibility for the mass harm they are causing. It's also cruel because Paul, Wayne, and Eva had to live in fear and had unnecessary expenses they had to pay for this when all they did was save suffering animals from animal cruelty!

I hope you will look at the evidence provided to you & prosecute Ridglan Farms for their animal cruelty. It's the right thing to do. And if you won't, I'd like to understand why not.

Thank you,

Some people who received this message don't often get email from olivieraandy@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

Hi,


I am writing because I have grave concerns that criminal animal abuse is being ignored in Dane County, specifically at Ridglan Farms. I learned that your office has prosecuted the rescuers of beagles from that abusive dog factory farm, but has done nothing about the abuse taking place at Ridglan Farms itself. What Ridglan does is on par with animal abuse in the notorious Yulin Festival in China. Dogs are confined in tiny cages with wire flooring which hurts their paws, mutilated and barely kept alive only to “look forward to” excruciating experiments that I can only call sadistic, and further mutilations, vivisection and eventual murder. Any such action by an individual would absolutely constitute animal cruelty. And yet it is allowed to happen on the US soil and on a huge scale. The USDA’s own inspectors have documented conditions that constitute violations of animal welfare laws. Why is the DA doing nothing about it and allowing this to continue to happen? You could be a hero for millions of Americans who are vehemently against cruelty to dogs and yet you are choosing to defend a heartless corporation. Most Americans are disgusted by the idea of hurting dogs. How is this OK with you?

Please prosecute the true villain here - Ridglan Farms.


Regards,

Andy Oliviera

You don't often get email from kenndalynzeleny@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

KENNDALYN Zeleny

Subject: re: Please stop the animal abuse in Dane County at Ridglan Farms

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,
Ridglan Farms in Dane County has been breeding dogs for animal experimentation  for decades and have been violation state cruelty laws in the process. The dogs are kept in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement. This is psychologically traumatizing. Surgical mutilations are preformed without anesthetics and without veterinarians. There is improper flooring resulting in foot injuries.
Instead of prosecuting Ridglan, you were focused on prosecuting people that rescued dogs and exposed the abuse happening behind closed doors.
Please prosecute Ridglan Farms, not the animal rescuers.
Thank you.
Sincerely,
Lynn Gallagher

1550 Taft Ave NE
Solon, Ia 52333

You don't often get email from gonzaloarteaga462@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,


I'm writing to inquire about any intentions you have about prosecuting Ridglan Farms in Dane County for what amounts to criminal animal abuse. It has come to light that, over decades, the company has been breeding dogs for torturous experiments. Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, by:


  *   Conducting surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confining dogs in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Implementing improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to continue enduring such criminal abuse. Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have chosen to instead prosecute the rescuers of these dogs. Prosecute Ridglan Farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Gonzalo Arteaga

I live in Dallas, Texas but have been following the Ridglan farms case due to my interest in animal welfare.   *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,

Grace Golabek

Some people who received this message don't often get email from jaylaothmer1@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

﻿I am writing today to address the issues at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. Over several decades the company has been breeding dogs for horrible experiments and setting them up for a lifetime of trauma. As the company breeds these dogs, they are also violating many animal cruelty laws. Ridglan has been observed by former employees and district attorney Ozanne while performing the following crimes:

1. Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present.

2. Confinement in small metal cages, often solitary confinement, causing physiological damage to the dogs.

3. Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections.

As you can see from the list above Ridglan farms needs to be prosecuted. It is beyond cruel and extremely inhumane to put thousands of dogs through this trauma and pain. The average lifespan of a dog is 10-13 years. They live a short life. As humans we have the right to protect their lives. Every animal deserves a chance just as well as humans. Many dogs at Ridglan farms do not get close to the average 10 year mark because of the cruelty and trauma they face. Most of us have dogs, or know someone who does. Could you imagine your dog going through a lifetime of suffering and insanity? I know that any person who has the slightest bit of empathy would take action to stop this abuse. Instead of prosecuting the rescuers, focus on the main problem at hand; the abuse happening to innocent dogs at Ridglan Farms.


Respectfully,

Jayla Othmer

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped immediately. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for horrific experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have chosen to prosecute the rescuers of these dogs. We are a nation that prides ourselves for our love of our dogs and cats. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Aaron Curry

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have been made aware of the criminal animal abuse taking place at Ridglan Farms in Dane County; it must be addressed, stopped and the offenders prosecuted. Over many decades, this company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:



  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present (example:  removal of the cherry eye gland without anesthesia).
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs.
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.

Individuals are prosecuted for these very actions and in no way should a company or corporation be immune to animal cruelty laws.  Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to continue to endure criminal abuse. Its long past time to fully investigate and prosecute Ridglan Farms.  Wouldn’t you seek justice if your own dog or other animal was treated so brutally?

Respectfully,

Lisa Vializ

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

I had no idea such facilities such as Ridglan Farms existed until today. I am beyond horrified and heartbroken. For an innocent animal to be born and bred for a life of such absolute pain and suffering is beyond my comprehension; animal research should be outlawed on a federal level. No animal should endure this. You have an opportunity on a county level to end so much suffering.

I pray that you are compelled to show mercy and take action to save to these innocent, intelligent dogs from a lifetime of horror.


Ridglan must be prosecuted and have their license to practice, and business license permanently revoked and removed for their multiple violations of the law. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Annie Lloyd

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County is occurring and must be addressed and stopped.   2.  Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  3.  Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Dear DA,
                I am more than certain you have received hundreds if not thousands of messages about prosecuting this business. I would like to make a small point to you to think about.

What if these were children? What if this was human trafficking? Most of us here love our pets and believe that harming innocent animals is never ok. Please think about the abuse these poor animals are going through. They never feel grass, sunlight, locked up their whole lives. All because we think it is ok to put a $ on an abused life. It really is not much different from human trafficking in a lot of countries. This organization needs to be closed till much better regulations and controls can be put into place. Things that grant these animals rights, and some enjoyment if life. No animal should NEVER ever be pushed to be used as a lab rat. Sure mice and small rodents are 1 thing, but these are much higher intelligent animals. They deserve a better life and not to be sold off for torture. They can run the same tests with rats and mice. There is zero reason they need beagles.

I hope you find it in your heard and really look at the law that defines abuse vs. licensing. This case is bigger than a simple decision. The world is watching what you do. Are you going to side with big $ or are you going to fight for real rights and make a difference? Some things go beyond $. This is one of them.

Kind regards,
Michael.

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Isabella Worth

Some people who received this message don't often get email from jaylasm06@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

﻿I am writing today to address the issues at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. Over several decades the company has been breeding dogs for horrible experiments and setting them up for a lifetime of trauma. As the company breeds these dogs, they are also violating many animal cruelty laws. Ridglan has been observed by former employees and district attorney Ozanne while performing the following crimes:

1. Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present.

2. Confinement in small metal cages, often solitary confinement, causing physiological damage to the dogs.

3. Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections.

As you can see from the list above Ridglan farms needs to be prosecuted. It is beyond cruel and extremely inhumane to put thousands of dogs through this trauma and pain. The average lifespan of a dog is 10-13 years. They live a short life. As humans we have the right to protect their lives. Every animal deserves a chance just as well as humans. Many dogs at Ridglan farms do not get close to the average 10 year mark because of the cruelty and trauma they face. Most of us have dogs, or know someone who does. Could you imagine your dog going through a lifetime of suffering and insanity? I know that any person who has the slightest bit of empathy would take action to stop this abuse. Instead of prosecuting the rescuers, focus on the main problem at hand; the abuse happening to innocent dogs at Ridglan Farms.


Respectfully,

Jayla Othmer

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped as soon as possible.

Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal and horrific experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, which so often lead to psychological trauma for the dogs

Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


The rescuers of these dogs have been wrongfully prosecuted, instead of Ridglan for the countless devastating offenses that has led to dogs passing away in brutal ways. Such ways have included dogs being force fed laundry detergent to the point of vomiting blood for several hours until they took their final breaths, facial mutilation to "practice plastic surgery" for dogs, and dogs being injected with rabies repeatedly to experiment vaccines.

Please, do not allow thousands more dogs in your county to endure such terrible criminal abuse. You could end the torture and the mutilation, along with the neverending crying of these innocent lifes.

Prosecute Ridglan Farms, not animal rescue.


Most respectfully,

Ms. Destiny Lowell

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I have been made aware of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. These crimes must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, that include:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies and more.

You don't often get email from watleydanielb@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
District Attorney Ozanne,

I am reaching out to express my concerns regarding the issue of criminal animal abuse occurring at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which demands immediate attention and action. Over the course of many decades, the company has been involved in breeding dogs for inhumane experimentation purposes. Throughout this time, Ridglan has been observed repeatedly violating state animal cruelty laws, including:

- Performing surgical mutilations without the administration of proper anesthetics or the presence of veterinarians
- Subjecting dogs to confinement in cramped metal cages, often in solitary conditions, resulting in severe psychological distress
- Maintaining improper flooring and housing conditions, leading to foot injuries and infections among vulnerable puppies

Instead of holding Ridglan accountable for these egregious offenses, there has been a troubling trend of prosecuting those individuals who have attempted to rescue these suffering animals. It is imperative that action is taken to prevent thousands of dogs within your county from enduring further criminal abuse. I urge you to prioritize the prosecution of Ridglan Farms, rather than targeting those involved in animal rescue efforts.

Respectfully,

Daniel Watley

Ridglan Farms, one of the last remaining beagle factory farms in the US., is committing criminal animal abuse Inside its facility, DxE investigators have documented dogs crammed into small cages, often alone, with no access to the outdoors; noxious air and feces building up beneath the cages; dogs with red and swollen feet from standing on wire cage floors; and dogs showing signs of extreme psychological torment like spinning endlessly in circles and bouncing off the cage walls.

Please do everything in your power to have these dogs placed in sanctuary homes and shelters, and close down this terrible operation that profits from dogs suffering!

The facility is not caring for the dogs. Dogs should not be used and treated this way.

Please help the dogs.

SIncerely,
Pat Lord

The verbiage below is cut and pasted verbatim from the sample prose prepared by an animal advocacy organization.  I am using it because it says what I want to express and there is no point in reinventing the wheel. Please do better.


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped.   *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

You don't often get email from nicol.tiffany@yahoo.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

As an animal lover I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Tiffany Nicol

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am deeply concerned about evidence of animal abuse happening to dogs who are

imprisoned at Ridglan Farms in Dane County.

This has been well documented and recorded and includes:


Confinement in small barren cages with clear evidence of psychological distress with repetitive behaviours and clear desperation for freedom.


Surgical procedures to stop dogs barking undertaken routinely, which is reprehensible physical abuse.


Lack of proper housing leading to foot injuries and infections in puppies


Seeing these animals in such distress isolated from each other  by steel, does not satisfy any decent ethical person’s view of animal welfare.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Yours faithfully


Dr Miranda Coulson

Some people who received this message don't often get email from cy574613@ohio.edu. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Hello,

Ridglan Farms (RF) has been reported for criminal animal abuse multiple times.

Not only is the establishment experimenting on beagles, an animal that is conventionally domesticated and protected by anti-animal abuse laws, but Ridglan Farms is also physically abusing the beagles through actions such as mutilation of infected areas of their bodies. The beagles are catching infections because 1.) they are being warehoused in small cages with neglect concerning their untenable living conditions, and 2.) they're being experimented on.

I became aware of this information because of Wayne Hsiung, an animal rights lawyer who has legally conflicted with RF but the company backed out of a lawsuit because they were afraid that the arguments he planned to use in court would lead to their own undoing.

Wayne posts on the social media website X footage of the abuse committed by RF, and he has interviewed a whistleblower (a former employee) regarding the alleged abuse ranging as far as mutilation by an individual who was NOT a certified veterinarian.

To my understanding, the State of Wisconsin has a law that allows the investigation of animal abuse of private residences without a warrant for the animal's safety as a protected person. When what would typically be a violation of civil liberties is implemented becomes legally justifiable for the protection of animals, my question is follows:

Why has Ridglan Farms been getting away with abusing animals that are, for many people, pets protected by animal abuse laws, for so long? Why they

Chris Yangas

"Animals are more than ever a test of our character, of mankind’s capacity for empathy and for decent, honorable conduct and faithful stewardship. We are called to treat them with kindness, not because they have rights or power or some claim to equality, but in a sense because they don’t; because they all stand unequal and powerless before us." Government Officials:

I’ve been opposing vivisection for decades. And I’m now asking you to do the same. Or, at the very least do your job and investigate and prosecute Ridglan Farms for violation of the state animal cruelty laws that already exist.

Dogs and humans are different anatomically, physiologically, histologically, immunologically, etc. Because of this fact experimenting on dogs and expecting something useful to come out of it for human health is insanity. Much the same insanity as if one were to expect to shed light on canine ailments by experimenting on humans!

Not only Ridglan is wasting tax dollar monies, but they are brutalizing innocent beings. I am sure you wouldn’t allow anyone to treat your dog in the manner. So why are you not taking action to prosecute Ridglan for the violations of animal cruelty laws of your state?

Enough is enough. Take action against Ridglan and hold them accountable.

Hoorik Telle
Florida, USA

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

You don't often get email from jonathanvajda1@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Jonathan T. Vajda

Some people who received this message don't often get email from mildredelisantiago@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
District Attorney Ozanne,

My name is Mildred Santiago. I live in Houston, TX, and I graduated from Texas A&M University in 2022. I am very fond of dogs, and have a soft spot for Beagles, thanks to the Charlie Brown comics.

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County is occurring as I am typing this email. There are hundreds, if not thousands of dogs that need our help to put an end to their abuse and cruelty. These are innocent animals that cannot leave, and do not have a voice of their own to defend themselves. You might, or might not have a dog, and this is an important matter. Over many decades, Ridglan Farms has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. In the case that you are not aware, they are mutilating these dogs without any real veterinary care, or even pain medicine/anesthesia. I cannot imagine the pain these poor animals suffer every day; I cannot even imagine a doctor performing surgery on me without medication. These poor animals are then confined in small metal cages, alone, without the comfort of someone. They are forced in solitude and forced to stand on wired cages and their own feces every second of their lives. This then leads to psychological trauma, as if their physical suffering was not enough. The wire in their cages cause foot injuries and infections that no one bothers to treat.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these innocent dogs. Please don't allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure animal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan Farms, do whatever it takes. Be their voice! You were put into a position where this is possible. You have vowed to serve, and now is your opportunity to show your community your commitment to those vows. This goes even beyond your own community. This story has reached people like me, in a completely different state.

I will email everyday if that is what it takes to get your attention. Please take action, and please advise if there is anything I can do to help this cause.

Best regards,

Mildred Santiago

(832) 655-8082
mildredelisantiago@gmail.com
Houston, TX

You don't often get email from tfarmstrong@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

I hope this email finds you well. I am reaching out to express my deep concerns regarding the ongoing issue of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. It is imperative that action is taken to address and put an end to these egregious practices.

For far too long, Ridglan Farms has been involved in breeding dogs for brutal experiments, spanning many decades. This has resulted in numerous violations of state animal cruelty laws, including but not limited to:

- Surgical mutilations being performed without the presence of anesthetics or veterinarians

- Confinement of animals in small metal cages, often in solitary conditions, leading to severe psychological trauma for the dogs

- Inadequate flooring and housing conditions, resulting in foot injuries and infections among vulnerable puppies

Despite these clear violations, it is concerning that instead of holding Ridglan Farms accountable for their actions, efforts have been directed towards prosecuting individuals involved in rescuing these mistreated animals. This approach is not only unjust but also fails to address the root cause of the problem.

I urge you to take immediate action to prosecute Ridglan Farms for their offenses and to ensure that justice is served for the thousands of dogs subjected to criminal abuse under their care. It is imperative that we prioritize the well-being and protection of these innocent animals and hold those responsible for their suffering accountable.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I trust that you will take the necessary steps to address these concerns promptly.

Respectfully,


Timothy Armstrong

Some people who received this message don't often get email from tessapacelli@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
District Attorney Ozanne:

My name is Tessa Pacelli and I am a dog owner and animal lover. I also have a background in science and business. My undergraduate degree is from Stanford University and my MBA is from Harvard Business School.

Having been exposed to and educated by some of the best in the best in science and business, I believe that:

(1) No reputable research program or scientist undertakes cruel, inhumane, abusive "experiments" on dogs.
(2) No reputable business tests consumer products on dogs when there are numerous other humane methods available.

I have watched videos, reviewed pictures, and read first hand accounts of the procedures and "experiments" at Ridglan. They are, quite simply, criminal animal abuse. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

- Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
- Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
- Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

I beg you to stand up for our canine friends in Dane County. They feel pain, cruelty. and sadness as real as any person. These beautiful dogs have done nothing to deserve the horrible fate of being a "lab animal" at Ridglan Farms - other than being sweet, calm, and pliant enough to be easily manipulated for "experiments".

I respectfully request that you take action to stop the criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Tessa Pacelli

You don't often get email from fayraeferris@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Good morning,

I am reaching out to voice my concerns about the significant evidence regarding criminal animal cruelty occurring at Rigdlan Farms, and the lack of prosecution up to this point.

Please consider pursuing justice in this case. When I notice people are apathetic or turning a blind eye to the blatant torture of captive animals, it makes me wonder what sort of abuse or mistreatment such an individual has learned to accept in their own life toward their own person.

It is a signal of our humanity to see the unnecessary torture of another sentient being and to feel moved to act. Our humanity is a gift, and it is a strength to care for the most vulnerable among us.

If you have a dog of your own, or if you have ever known a dog that you loved, please consider how you would feel to see that dog trapped in a cage its entire life, only to be force fed caustic chemicals or be surgically mutilated without anesthesia.

There are laws in place to protect animals from this type of treatment. But laws are only effective if they are upheld.

I know this is a difficult matter to face, but it's an important one. The way we treat and care for others is a reflection of the way we treat and care for ourselves.

I don't have to know you personally to know that you deserve care, compassion, love, and to be defended against abusive captivity. I hope you believe that about yourself as well.

Thank you for reading, and hopefully for being part of the movement toward treating animals with the respect and dignity we all want for ourselves.

Sincerely,
Fay Rae

You don't often get email from sabrinamary.gentile@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Dear DA Ozanne,
I am a concerned citizen of Dane County. I have recently been made aware of a Class A purpose bred beagle dealer in Dane County, called Ridglan Farms, which has roughly 3000 dogs on site.  The current operation of this business falls far short of acceptable veterinary practices.  Ridglan Farms should be reported to proper authorities.  A private pet owner would be charged with animal abuse.

A similar facility, Envigo in Virginia, was closed after members of Congress expressed concerns about the USDA's failure to enforce the Animal Welfare Act.  It took public outcry and lawmakers outside the USDA to expose that facility and the inhumane conditions and neglect.  A similar type of investigation needs to be considered for the Ridglan facility in our own backyard.

It is my understanding that this facility falls under regulation of both the USDA, as well as Wisconsin DATCP.  Inspections by state and federal inspectors observed many concerning conditions including: Many adult dogs stacked in cages with mesh flooring, dogs not being removed from enclosure for exercise, dogs not provided any outdoor enclosures, several dogs being treated for health problems, many dogs displaying prominent stereotypical behaviors (circling, pacing, wall bouncing) -- symptoms of severe stress.  What is unclear is how this facility continues to operate with impunity with noted violations that have continued over many years.

Wisconsin is progressive in many important matters--we cannot allow these innocent animals to suffer in inhumane conditions.  I ask you to please consider an independent investigation of Ridglan Farms.

Sincerely,
Sabrina Gentile
774 Sky Ridge Dr.
Madison, WI 53719
608.206.1518
sabrinamary.gentile@gmail.com<mailto:sabrinamary.gentile@gmail.com>

You don't often get email from dslaschiava@comcast.net. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
Dane County District Attorney Ismael Ozanne,

I am contacting you today to urge you to investigate and prosecute Ridglan Farms for criminal activity involving both State animal cruelty and Federal Animal Welfare Act (AWA) violations.  DxE investigators have documented the filthy conditions at the Ridglan Farms facility as well as the horrific physical and psychological trauma of the dogs shown spinning endlessly inside small barren cages.  Their investigation also clearly revealed Ridglan Farms violating state and federal animal welfare laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing severe foot injuries and infections in puppies

While I am relieved to have learned that the state has dropped all the charges against Eva Hamer, Paul Darwin Picklesimer, and Wayne Hsiung, this does not
absolve the state of its responsibility in holding Ridglan Farms accountable for their criminal violation of animal welfare laws causing unspeakable torment and torture
of the dogs at their facility. It was a gut-wrenching experience for me to view the
DxE video. I am 100% certain that had the trial convened, the public at large would have been outraged as well!

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these hideous offenses, you chose instead to prosecute the rescuers of these dogs. It would be an appalling injustice and egregious insult to the Rule of Law to continue to allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure any further criminal abuse and unspeakable suffering for one moment longer.

I implore you to do the right thing and prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue!

Most Sincerely,

Dona LaSchiava
DSL Animal Advocacy
556 W. Paseo Solana
Green Valley, AZ  85614

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Petra Dorn


Sent from my iPhone

﻿ Hello,

 I have grave concerns that criminal animal abuse is being ignored in Dane County, specifically at Ridglan Farms, a dog breeder.  Your office has prosecuted the rescuers of beagles from horrific conditions but has done nothing about the abuse taking place at Ridglan Farms itself.

 It’s a breeder of beagles sold for animal experiments. Investigations have documented instances of surgical mutilations, cruel confinement in tiny cages, dogs spinning out of stress and psychological torment, and injuries to their feet due to the metal wire they stand on all day.

Ridglan Farms deserves an investigation.

Thank you for looking into this.
Liz Sauer

I am writing to express my deep concern regarding the ongoing issue at Ridglan Farms in Dane County.

The treatment of animals on their premises raises serious ethical and legal questions that demand attention. Instances of surgical procedures performed without appropriate anesthesia or veterinary oversight, as well as the confinement of animals in substandard conditions, highlight a pattern of disregard for animal welfare laws.

It is troubling to note that, rather than addressing these violations directly, there appears to be a focus on prosecuting individuals attempting to intervene and rescue the affected animals.

I respectfully urge you to prioritize the investigation and prosecution of Ridglan Farms for their alleged violations, ensuring that justice is served and that the well-being of the animals is safeguarded.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Edyta Klimkiewicz

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that there is criminal animal abuse happening at Ridglan Farms in Dane County and the people think this must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present including mutilation of vocal cords of a beagle because he wouldn’t stop howling.
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs which causes them to do things such as circle endlessly.
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted a rescuers of some of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Please, prosecute Ridglan farms, don’t prosecute against an animal rescue organization that just wants these creatures to live a normal doggy life.

Respectfully,

Charles Pate

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

I hope all is well.  I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County is rampant and must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

- Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
- Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
- Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.  The feelings of these poor animals are no less than ours.  Please reconsider.  The most vulnerable, defenseless, and innocent beings deserve the utmost love and care and lives free of torture and killing.

Respectfully,

Krishna Majmudar

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


The company is objectively abusing their dogs - often to the death - and any animal owner who abuses their animals is legally subject to having their animals taken away. There is no arguing that. People who rescue animals from abusive owners are morally justified and often already legally protected in most cases concerning dogs; there is logically no reason for that same legal justification and protection to be withheld from the rescuers of the Ridglan beagles.


Respectfully,

Natalia Blancas

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Honorable District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies
Dogs are sentient mammals that form strong bonds with their young, other mammals and humans.  They experience physical pain, post-traumatic stress disorder and depression from maltreatment and torture, just as humans did when Hitler’s Dr. Mengele conducted his cruel experiments on humans and animals at the death camps. That is why violations like Ridglan’s were made criminal offenses.

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

Debra S. Borys PhD FABPS

Hello, I am writing to the office of the District Attorney in hopes that they will listen to the thousands of people, myself included part of the #BegalBetrayal movement asking them to shut down Ridgland Farms and charge them with animal abuse! I stand with Wayne Hsihung and his attorneys that are attempting to end the suffering and abuse of thousands of Beagles. These poor animals are forced to live in horrible and abusive conditions every day of their life, knowing nothing but abuse in a cage, yet the company has the audacity to say they provide them with good care and medical support, but they do things such as illegally surgically mutilate dogs without anesthesia, pain medication or an actual veterinarian present. Surgeries being done to humans aren't done when they're awake they give them pain medication or anesthesia. They don't just cut into a human because obviously it would hurt. Obviously it would panic the person if they saw what was being done to them especially if they knew that the person operating on them had no medical training whatsoever, yet they expect these poor dogs to go through all of these horrible abuses that they themselves wouldn't go through yet they expected to just endure it. They can't say anything because the dogs don't have a voice like people do and that's why I am standing up for them and being their voice and millions of people like me in the world feel the same, thousands of people feel the same way about this movement, and I hope that you listen to us and actually do something to help these dogs.These poor dogs will never know the joy of being loved by a family. They will never get to know what it feels like to run in grass and play with a squeaky toy or chew a bone. They will never get to know what it is like to feel safe and loved. These poor dogs will live their entire lives in torture and suffering and wonder what they did to deserve that. I don't know how any human being could allow for something like this to happen let alone know about it and actively do nothing about it. Would any of this be acceptable for humans? If this were happening to humans, would you care then would something actually be being done to help these animals? Animals have emotions and feelings just like people do, there is no actual scientific reason as to why animal testing is used it's simply because "people have rights and dogs don't". Dogs deserve the same respect we give to humans. How can your attorneys defend  murders and animal mutilators? The law is supposed to bring justice to those who do wrong, however in this case and many others justice has not been served. Serve justice to Ridgland Farms. Shut down this horrible torturous and abusive place and hold all of them responsible for the horrible, heinous crimes that they have done.
I stand with these animals and the attorney decedent them! #BeagleBetrayal

﻿
﻿I am writing to ask whether District Attorney Ismael Ozanne is planning to do anything about the criminal animal cruelty taking place at Ridglan Farms.  This mass breeder sells beagles for animal experiments. Investigations have documented dogs crammed into small cages, often alone, with no access to the outdoors; noxious air & feces building up beneath the cages; dogs with red & swollen feet from standing on wire cage floors all day; instances of surgical mutilations; and signs of extreme psychological torment like spinning endlessly in circles & bouncing off the cage walls.

On March 8, you dropped all charges against three people who were involved in a DxE investigation and open rescue at Ridglan Farms in 2017. While this is a small win for the Right to Rescue (and a sign that public pressure works!), it is also a clear attempt to cover up animal cruelty that would have been exposed in court.

Animal abuse is criminal, not to mention the victims being a species cherished by a society that calls it Men’s Best Friend. I am appalled by the inaction of authorities to do their job. But there is still time for you to make the right choice.

﻿Katie Yu

District Attorney Ozanne,
I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal
cruelty laws, such as:
● Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
● Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
● Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies
Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse.
Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.
Respectfully,
Lauren

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Your Name

Tammy Durante

Some people who received this message don't often get email from vegannotviolence@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne


I am writing to you in regards to the absolutely criminal abuse of the dogs at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which must be addressed and stopped immediately.

Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead, unbelievably, prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure this sick, criminal abuse. Prosecute the animal abusers at Ridglan farms, NOT animal protectors!


Yours sincerely

Susan Buckland






Some people who received this message don't often get email from rivorientus@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   1. Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   2. Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   3. Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offences, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. What you are doing is wrong, animals are not “property” or “things”. They feel, they fear, they long for freedom, and they didn’t do anything wrong to us. They do not have a voice so we must be the ones who speak for them. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

River

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue. And if you don’t do anything about it you’re just a dirty little rat like the rest of them animals matter to not just your pockets. How would you like to be caged up and have your vocal cords cut out.

Respectfully,

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

I just read an email regarding one of the last remaining Beagle factory farms in the U.S. and frankly I was completely appalled and thoroughly disgusted, and very saddened.  How is it possible in this day and age that the people and the state of Wisconsin are still allowing this cruel midevil torture of man's best friend - - and one of the cutest and sweetest dog breeds on the planet

I am a former Beagle owner. I had my Beagle from the age of 8 weeks to when I had to put him to sleep at 16 years old due to congestive heart failure and I am, again, saddened and appalled that you are letting the torture of these dogs happen for years now!  Labs are finally being shut down that have tortured animals, Beagles being the top dog in their torture because of their calm, sweet and gentle nature.  IT IS SO SAD YOU ARE ALLOWING THE CONTINUED TORTURE OF THESE BEAGLES IN THAT HORRIBLE PLACE'S FACTORY FARM.  What is wrong with the District Attorney and the Prosecutors in your state?  Are they being paid off perhaps by this factory torture farm? I mean, what is going on there?  Its unconscionable!  I've got to tell you, I don't know of any other reason that could make the continuous torture of animals go on - - unless you all just hate animals and want to see sweet little Beagles be tortured and keep them SUFFER!ING EVERY SINGLE DAY YEAR AFTER YEAR AFTER YEAR!

Animal rights activists have been outside your offices and yet, you dropped the charges on 3 people who investigated Rigdlan but that only allowed for the continued "coverup" of what's going on there. i read that the charges were dropped against the animal advocates way back in 2017!  So that means that you people  have done NOTHING for these poor suffering dogs since then and that's 8 YEARS!!!  SO HOW LONG HAS THIS PLACE BEEN ABLE TO CONTINUE TORTURING ANIMALS?  WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR - - THIS IS HAPPENING ON YOUR WATCH YEAR AFTER YEAR!  So, is it that you ARE being paid off or are you animal haters and enjoy going to sleep at night knowing how all of those dogs continue to suffer every single day ofr their poor sad lives? Which is it?

Investigators have documented dogs crammed into small cages, often alone, with no access to the outdoors; noxious air and feces building up beneath the cages; dogs with red and swollen feet from standing on wire cage floors; and dogs showing signs of extreme psychological torment like spinning endlessly in circles and bouncing off the cage walls.

THE DOGS ARE NOT ONLY SUFFERING PHYSICALLY, THEY ARE EXTREMELY SUFFERING EMOTIONALLY!  When an animal spins around in a small cage round and round and round, bouncing off the walls of that small cage - - THAT IS EXTREME EXTREME CRUELTY!

WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU PEOPLE?  YOU HAVE THE POWER TO STOP THIS BUT YOU DO NOTHING!  YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES!

END THIS TORTURE NOW - - NOT NEXT YEAR OR 2 OR 3 OR 6 YEARS FROM NOW - - END IT NOW!  ITS JUST UNBELEIVEABLE YOU ARE LETTING THIS GO ON WHEN YOU HAVE THE POWER TO STOP IT.  PLEASE BE A DECENT HUMAN BEING AND STOP THIS TORTURE AND ABUSE FROM INNOCENT ANIMALS THAT HAVE DONE NOTHING TO ANYBODY.  The state of WI needs to take these dogs out of their torture chambers, take them all to a vet, and eventually find them homes!  THAT'S IT, THAT'S YOUR JOB!  STOP BEING DISPICABLE HUMANS AND DO YOUR DAMN JOB!

I am reaching out to you regarding the concerns I have that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

•Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

•Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

•Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

I advocate today on behalf of the animals suffering abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. The criminals who work at this facility have been breeding dogs for cruel experiments for decades, violating state animal cruelty laws such as:

-Surgical mutilations without anesthetics nor veterinarians present

-Confinement of animals to cramped, uncomfortable metal cages, often in solitary confinement without proper socialization nor play resulting in psychological traumas

District Attorney Ozanne,

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.

Respectfully,


Eira Arenas

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present
  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs
  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

P.s.
I want you to imagine tomorrow you've switched lives with one of these dogs. You live in torment and none of it makes sense, you know you're good and don't deserve this. Several week or months pass and one day your life changes. Someone stepped up and put a stop to the cruelty you experience day after day and you're finally free. Whatever they did to make it happen, they did it. Imagine how learning what it's like to be cared for and loved for the first time in your life feels like. One person can make a difference. Don't you want to look back on your career and be able to say "I did it, I made a difference."? Thank you.



[You don't often get email from ummusulaim11@gmail.com. Learn why this is important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ]

I have just learnt about the appalling conditions and suffering these dogs have to endure.

Please please please set them free and have nothing to do with this animal cruelty anymore.
Thankyou for your kind attention.  I know you have a heart.

Salehah
Sent from my iPhone


You don't often get email from stephencolley@pacbell.net. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>
District Attorney Ozanne

I recently learned about the decades-long breeding of dogs at Dane County's Ridglan Farms for use in animal experiments. Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies

You've prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. But please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Please prosecute Ridglan farms. Would that not be a just thing to do, and save so many fellow creatures from such human-inflicted suffering?

Thanks for reading this...
Stephen Colley



You don't often get email from kerrieespuga@gmail.com. Learn why this is important<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

Dear Officials,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


-Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present.

-Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs.

-Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.



Respectfully,



Kerrie Espuga

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


I work in clinical research at Mount Sinai and can confirm that this treatment of animals is NOT NECESSARY for the advancement of science. Please consider the suffering of these animals.


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully,


Jonah Poczobutt

I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:

Algunos contactos que recibieron este mensaje no suelen recibir correos electrónicos de spermatodonte@outlook.com. Por qué esto es importante<https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification>

District Attorney Ozanne,


I am writing because I have concerns that criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County must be addressed and stopped. Over many decades, the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments. During that time, Ridglan has been observed violating state animal cruelty laws, such as:


  *   Surgical mutilations without anesthetics or veterinarians present

  *   Confinement in small metal cages, often in solitary confinement, leading to psychological trauma for the dogs

  *   Improper flooring and housing, causing foot injuries and infections in puppies


Instead of prosecuting Ridglan for these offenses, you have instead prosecuted the rescuers of these dogs. Please do not allow thousands of dogs in your county to endure criminal abuse. Prosecute Ridglan farms, not animal rescue.


Respectfully.


Francisco González Benito.

District Attorney Ozanne,

I hope this email finds you well. I am reaching out with deep concern regarding the ongoing criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. It has come to my attention that the company has been breeding dogs for brutal experiments over many decades, with numerous reports of egregious violations of state animal cruelty laws.

Some of the documented violations include surgical mutilations without the presence of anesthetics or veterinarians, confinement of dogs in small metal cages often in solitary conditions leading to severe psychological trauma, and inadequate flooring and housing resulting in foot injuries and infections, especially among vulnerable puppies.

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,

I am reaching out to you with deep concerns regarding the ongoing issue of criminal animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County. It has come to my attention that the company has been perpetrating egregious acts of cruelty against animals for many decades, particularly in the context of breeding dogs for brutal experiments.

Despite numerous instances of Ridglan Farms violating state animal cruelty laws, including but not limited to:

  *   Performing surgical mutilations on animals without the presence of anesthetics or qualified veterinarians.
  *   Subjecting animals to confinement in cramped metal cages, often in solitary conditions, resulting in severe psychological trauma.
  *   Maintaining inadequate flooring and housing conditions, leading to debilitating foot injuries and infections, especially among vulnerable puppies.

Instead of pursuing legal action against Ridglan Farms for these blatant offenses, it has come to my attention that your office has chosen to prosecute individuals attempting to rescue these innocent animals. This deeply troubling approach fails to uphold justice and allows thousands of dogs within your jurisdiction to continue suffering from criminal abuse.

I implore you to reconsider your course of action and take decisive steps to hold Ridglan Farms accountable for their reprehensible actions. It is imperative that the perpetrators of such heinous acts face the full extent of the law, rather than those who are working tirelessly to protect and save these animals from further harm.

Please, let justice prevail, and prioritize the prosecution of Ridglan Farms for their egregious violations of animal welfare laws.

Respectfully,
Shreshtha Jain

 I am reaching out to express my deep concerns regarding ongoing issues at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, which I believe demand immediate legal attention. It has come to my attention that the facility has been engaged in practices that could constitute criminal animal abuse, specifically in their handling and treatment of dogs used in experimental procedures. Reports and observations suggest a troubling pattern of behavior at Ridglan Farms,

including:

 - Performing surgical procedures on animals without the use of anesthesia or the presence of qualified veterinary care.
- Keeping dogs isolated in cramped metal enclosures, a situation that can lead to severe psychological distress.
- Utilizing inadequate flooring materials, contributing to a high incidence of injuries and infections among the animals, especially young puppies. While I understand the complexities involved in cases related to animal welfare, it concerns me that actions taken so far have targeted individuals attempting to intervene on behalf of these animals rather than addressing the root cause of the abuse at Ridglan Farms.

 I respectfully urge your office to reevaluate the situation at Ridglan Farms with a view towards holding those responsible for these cruel practices accountable under the law. Dear Dane County DA,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention a troubling matter regarding animal welfare violations that have been documented by investigators, including the USDA's own inspectors.

It has come to light that despite the clear evidence of violations of animal welfare laws, District Attorney Ismael Ozanne has chosen to prosecute beagle rescuers rather than address the issue of criminal animal cruelty. The documented conditions include instances of surgical mutilation without proper anesthesia or veterinary oversight, cruel confinement in tiny metal cages leading to psychological torment, and improper wire flooring causing injuries and infections to the dogs.

These abuses have been ongoing for several years, with no visible efforts to rectify the situation, as recent as December 2023. It is deeply concerning that such inhumane treatment of animals continues unchecked.

Dear District Attorney Ozanne,


I am reaching out to express my deep concerns regarding the ongoing animal abuse at Ridglan Farms in Dane County, an issue that demands immediate legal intervention. For several decades, this establishment has been implicated in the breeding of dogs for experiments characterized by inhumane practices. It has come to light that Ridglan Farms has repeatedly violated state animal cruelty statutes through actions that include:


- Performing surgical mutilations on dogs without the use of anesthetics or the supervision of qualified veterinarians.

- Subjecting animals to confinement in small, metal cages for prolonged periods, often in isolation, which results in severe psychological distress.

- Maintaining inadequate flooring and housing conditions, leading directly to foot injuries and infections among the puppies.


Despite these clear violations, it has been noted with concern that legal action has predominantly targeted individuals attempting to rescue these dogs, rather than prosecuting the entity responsible for their suffering. This approach not only undermines efforts to protect vulnerable animals but also permits the perpetuation of cruelty under your jurisdiction.


I urge you to reconsider the stance taken on this matter and to prioritize the prosecution of Ridglan Farms for its continued illegal and unethical treatment of animals. It is crucial that we take a stand against such injustices to prevent the needless suffering of thousands of dogs within Dane County.

I wish to provide crucial, first-hand insight into the life-long traumas these dogs endure as a result of being bred in captivity in deplorable conditions only to be sold for animal testing purposes.

I also wish to provide you with my own first-hand experiences that occurred during my time visiting Madison in 2022.  I will provide you with a first-hand account of how Madison, and therefore Dane County, is inept in understanding not only civil rights for disabled persons such as myself but also implements practices that infringe upon the rules and regulations regarding service animals.  Specifically, I am referring to my experience at the Olbrich Botanical Gardens which, according to the Olbrich Botanical Gardens website, is a direct extension of the City of Madison.

I have grave concerns that government bodies within the State of Madison are ill equipped to handle cases involving heavy bioethical decisions where the welfare of sentient beings are involved- especially considering that I have personal experience that the City of Madison itself neither enforces nor understands the basic civil liberties protected by the U.S. Department of Justice and Civil Rights.

I appreciate your time and consideration.  For transparency, I will be submitting copies of this letter to other organizations, such as but not limited to the Department of Justice (Civil Rights Division),  that I feel may also benefit from the information within its contents.
